section.title: Mac OS X Compiler
section.para: On Mac OS X you can also try the commands explained in to check if you have the necessary tools installed. If not, you will need to install the developer tools

section.title: Mac OS X up to Snow Leopard (10.6)
section.para: The developer tools are either on one of your Mac OS X CDs that came with your computer, or you can download them at: Apple's developer connection.

section.title: Mac OS X Lion (10.7) and Newer
section.para: To get the compiler, you have to install developer tools (Xcode) from the App Store. After downloading, you have to run the installer to actually install the developer tools.

note.para: If you have upgraded to Lion from an older version of OS X, you have to redo both of these steps (download + install). Upgrading to Lion breaks your existing developer tools. Again: You have to do this after an upgrade to Lion, even if you have previously installed the developer tools!

section.para: After you've downloaded developer tools (Xcode), you have to go to your Applications folder and run the installer.

figure.title: Run the Xcode installer from Applications

section.para: During the install, you may encounter the following error messages:

varlistentry.term: In order to continue installation, please close the following application: iTunes

listitem.para: You may need to do two things:
Close iTunes, see if that helped.
In a Terminal window, type: killall iTunesHelper

varlistentry.term: No matching processes belonging to you were found

listitem.para: This can happen if your Unix username contains a space. The workaround is to create an admin user to be used during the installation.
Open system preferences, go to "Users and groups"
Unlock the user preferences, type in you password
Click on "+" to create a new user
For fullname and account name enter something in all lower cases without spaces, e.g. "admin".
In der Dropdownmenu for "new account" change "Standard" to "Administrator".
Log out, and log back in as your new admin user.
Log out, log back in as your normal user
Delete the admin user (System preferences, Users and Groups, unlock, select the admin user, click on "-")
